acuation, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public if a release occurs.

Employees receive training in the procedures to be followed by employees who remain to operate critical facility operations before they evacuate. Vaquero has around-the-clock communications capability with appropriate emergency response organizations (Fire Department, Police and Sheriff's Office). This interface provides the means of notifying the public of an incident, if necessary, as well as facilitating quick response to an incident. In addition, Vaquero conducts periodic emergency drills and annual refresher training for plant personnel.

DESCRIPTION OF THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE

Vaquero Permian Gathering LLC (Vaquero) owns a facility with a compressor station and an 18,000 gallon natural gas liquid (NGL) bullet tank.  The Cedar Ridge Facility is located near the town of Coyanosa in Reeves County, Texas. The facility is designed to separate NGLs from gathered natural gas.  NGLs are separated from condensate and produced water.  The NGLs are stored in the 18,000 gallon bullet tank and later will be transferred and processed in a natural gas processing facility. 

The NGL mixture can contain the following components:
a. Methane
b. Ethane
c. Propane
d. Butane
e. Isobutane
f. Pentane
g. Isopentane
h. carbons larger than C5+

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

Cedar Ridge Facility is newly built and has had no RMP-regulated substance release during the past five years. 

PUBLIC RECEPTORS

No receptors were identified within the 0.32 mile distance to flammable endpoint.  The Cedar Ridge Facility is located within a rural area.  Using information gathered during field reconnaissance on October 6, 2015 and census tract data, it was determined that zero persons live within the distance to flammable endpoint.  No other public receptors including schools, residences, hospitals, prisons, public recreational areas or arenas, or commercial or industrial areas were observed within the distance to flammable endpoint.  In addition, no environmental receptors were identified on the local U.S. Geological Survey topographic map.


EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM INFORMATION

Vaquero's Cedar Ridge Facility is a Non-Responding Facility as per 48 CFR 68.90(b). The plant maintains a written emergency action plan, which is in place to help protect employees and public safety as well as the environment.
